column1: Therefore, it is not safe to allow the conviction of the 5th accused-appellant for the 1st count.
In the circumstances this court is inclined to set aside the conviction and the punishments
imposed on the 5th accused-appellant for the 1st count.
The infirmities in the judgment support the contention that the finding of the learned trial
Judgeâ€™s judgment is unsound in law. For the reasons set out above, I conclude that the learned
trial Judge had misdirected himself by failing to evaluate the said material in favour of the
I, therefore, decide to set aside the conviction and sentence dated 22.03.2017.
The appeal of the accused-appellant is allowed.
Accused-appellant is acquitted and discharged from all counts in the indictment.
